channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: You tried it Misty Stanley-Jones ? It don't come out the best. Long lines run off the edge, etc.
I'm working on it. Most of the way there.
Blergh. This is not fun. Looks like it will require some refactoring of the XML to make the PDF look nice. I will work on it bit by bit in my spare time.

I can't attach the PDF because it's too big. Any bright ideas on how to make it available for review? The patch also includes symlinks in src/main/asciidoc and src/main/asciidoc/_chapters to src/main/site/images, which will make the images render when you view the .adoc files in Github.

I'd love review, especially from Stack and Nick Dimiduk.
Also I didn't add the PDF to the site menu in this patch. I'd be able to do that on commit. I'd love ideas on a way to rename the PDF via Maven as part of the site goal.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12702402/HBASE-11670.patch
against master branch at commit 883d6fd8e512b14c967d2f7acf78d2b1d40e40fe.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12702402

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+0 tests included. The patch appears to be a documentation patch that doesn't require tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 2 warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

-1 release audit. The applied patch generated 1 release audit warnings (more than the master's current 0 warnings).

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+button,html input[type="button"],input[type="reset"],input[type="submit"]{-webkit-appearance:button;cursor:pointer}
+input[type="search"]{-webkit-appearance:textfield;-moz-box-sizing:content-box;-webkit-box-sizing:content-box;box-sizing:content-box}
+input[type="search"]::-webkit-search-cancel-button,input[type="search"]::-webkit-search-decoration{-webkit-appearance:none}
+body

{background:#fff;color:rgba(0,0,0,.8);padding:0;margin:0;font-family:"Noto Serif","DejaVu Serif",serif;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;line-height:1;position:relative;cursor:auto}

+p.lead,.paragraph.lead>p,#preamble>.sectionbody>.paragraph:first-of-type p

{font-size:1.21875em;line-height:1.6}

+.subheader,.admonitionblock td.content>.title,.audioblock>.title,.exampleblock>.title,.imageblock>.title,.listingblock>.title,.literalblock>.title,.stemblock>.title,.openblock>.title,.paragraph>.title,.quoteblock>.title,table.tableblock>.title,.verseblock>.title,.videoblock>.title,.dlist>.title,.olist>.title,.ulist>.title,.qlist>.title,.hdlist>.title

{line-height:1.45;color:#7a2518;font-weight:400;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:.25em}

+div,dl,dt,dd,ul,ol,li,h1,h2,h3,#toctitle,.sidebarblock>.content>.title,h4,h5,h6,pre,form,p,blockquote,th,td

{margin:0;padding:0;direction:ltr}

+p

{font-family:inherit;font-weight:400;font-size:1em;line-height:1.6;margin-bottom:1.25em;text-rendering:optimizeLegibility}

+h1,h2,h3,#toctitle,.sidebarblock>.content>.title,h4,h5,h6

{font-family:"Open Sans","DejaVu Sans",sans-serif;font-weight:300;font-style:normal;color:#ba3925;text-rendering:optimizeLegibility;margin-top:1em;margin-bottom:.5em;line-height:1.0125em}

+h1 small,h2 small,h3 small,#toctitle small,.sidebarblock>.content>.title small,h4 small,h5 small,h6 small

{font-size:60%;color:#e99b8f;line-height:0}

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

-1 core zombie tests. There are 1 zombie test(s): at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.TestDatanodeManager.testNumVersionsReportedCorrect(TestDatanodeManager.java:133)

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13078//testReport/
Release audit warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13078//artifact/patchprocess/patchReleaseAuditWarnings.txt
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13078//artifact/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop2-compat.html

Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13078//artifact/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-client.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13078//console

This message is automatically generated.

Just commit Misty Stanley-Jones Lets look at it in-situ.

I'd love ideas on a way to rename the PDF via Maven as part of the site goal.

Tell us more. What is the name now and what is wrong with it?
It's currently book.pdf, because the book file is book.adoc. I'd like to rename it to something like apache_hbase_reference_guide.pdf. Not sure the best way to do this in Maven.

Looking at ascii doc mvn plugin, https://github.com/asciidoctor/asciidoctor-maven-plugin, it does not seem like document name is a config you can set. It does allow you set asciidoc attributes. What if you set 'docfile' which is 'Name of document file' (from http://asciidoctor.org/docs/user-manual/). It probably won't work. What about adding an execution that is run post-site (see how around this part of pom stuff gets hitched to the 'site' and 'pre-site' phase... could you add a post-site phase that did the doc rename?)
Got the renaming thing sorted and made some other improvements. This is what I'll commit.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12702645/HBASE-11670-v1.patch
against master branch at commit 39425a8558fabaffa0e2b9421a8a7926d73b040c.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Hi Misty Stanley-Jones. You and stack work through the issues? Looks like something was committed. How can I help?
PDF is live and accessible from the Documentation menu of the site.
